assessment.name: Technizium Security Posture Review
assessment.scope: Enterprise IT infrastructure, cloud services, and DevOps pipeline

AC-1.notes: Comprehensive access control policies implemented with quarterly reviews. Fully documented and distributed to all employees.

AC-2.notes: Automated account management with integration to HR systems. Regular privilege reviews conducted monthly.

AC-3.notes: Zero Trust model implemented with fine-grained access controls. Attribute-based access control (ABAC) deployed enterprise-wide.

AC-4.notes: Next-gen DLP solutions deployed with advanced data flow controls. Micro-segmentation implemented across network.

AT-1.notes: Training policies exceed industry standards. Regular updates based on threat intelligence.

AT-2.notes: Monthly awareness training with advanced phishing simulations. Completion rates above 98%.

AT-3.notes: Specialized role-based training for all security and IT personnel. External certifications required for key roles.

AT-4.notes: Advanced LMS with automated compliance tracking. Executive dashboard for training metrics.

AU-1.notes: Mature audit policies with regular reviews. Stakeholder input incorporated quarterly.

AU-2.notes: Comprehensive logging across all systems. Advanced correlation with threat intelligence.

AU-3.notes: Enriched audit records with contextual information. Custom fields added based on risk assessment.

AU-4.notes: Storage allocated for most systems, but some legacy applications have limited capacity that should be upgraded.

CA-1.notes: Robust assessment policies with clear roles and responsibilities. Updated annually.

CA-2.notes: Continuous assessment methodology implemented. Red team exercises conducted quarterly.

CA-3.notes: Strong interconnection agreements for most systems. Some new partner connections need formal agreements to be finalized.

CA-4.notes: Automated POA&M tracking with executive dashboards. Remediation timelines enforced.

CM-1.notes: Mature configuration management program. Policies aligned with DevSecOps practices.

CM-2.notes: Infrastructure as Code with security guardrails. Hardened baseline configurations for all platforms.

CM-3.notes: Automated change control integrated with CI/CD pipeline. Security gates for all deployments.

CM-4.notes: Most changes undergo security impact analysis, but emergency changes need better post-implementation review procedures.

CP-1.notes: Comprehensive contingency planning policies. Executive sponsorship with dedicated resources.

CP-2.notes: Detailed contingency plans with specific recovery objectives for all critical systems.

CP-3.notes: Regular training for IT staff, but business unit participation could be improved.

CP-4.notes: Quarterly testing including full DR exercises for critical systems. Test results drive continuous improvement.

IA-1.notes: Comprehensive identification and authentication policies. Regular review cycles.

IA-2.notes: Advanced MFA across all systems. Passwordless authentication implemented for most use cases.

IA-3.notes: Device authentication implemented for most devices. IoT devices need stronger authentication mechanisms.

IA-4.notes: Automated lifecycle management for all identifiers. Integration with HR for personnel changes.

IR-1.notes: Mature incident response policies aligned with industry frameworks. Regular updates based on lessons learned.

IR-2.notes: Comprehensive training program for IR team. Advanced scenario-based training.

IR-3.notes: Regular testing including red team exercises. External penetration testing conducted quarterly.

IR-4.notes: 24/7 SOC with advanced playbooks and automation. Integration with threat intelligence platforms.

MA-1.notes: Well-defined maintenance policies covering all system types including cloud resources.

MA-2.notes: Scheduled maintenance with appropriate approvals. Comprehensive documentation of all activities.

MA-3.notes: Controls for maintenance tools in place, but need better inventory and inspection processes.

MA-4.notes: Secure remote maintenance infrastructure with strong authentication and monitoring.

MP-1.notes: Comprehensive media protection policies. Clear procedures for all media types.

MP-2.notes: Strong access controls for all media storage areas. Digital media encrypted by default.

MP-3.notes: Automated marking for digital media, but physical media marking needs more consistency.

MP-4.notes: Secure storage solutions for all sensitive media. Environmental controls in all storage locations.

PA-1.notes: Strong physical access policies with regular reviews and updates.

PA-2.notes: Automated access control lists with integration to HR systems for personnel changes.

PA-3.notes: Multi-factor physical access controls at all facilities. Video surveillance with AI-based monitoring.

PA-4.notes: Transmission lines protected in main facilities, but some branch offices need physical security upgrades.

PE-1.notes: Comprehensive physical and environmental protection policies covering all facilities.

PE-2.notes: Automated physical access authorization with regular reviews and validation.
